member.name: T:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.BlendMode
member.summary: Specifies the blend mode to use when compositing images or drawings.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.BlendMode.Normal
member.summary: Normal blending mode which simply draws the source over the destination.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.BlendMode.Multiply
member.summary: Multiplies the colors of the source with the destination, resulting in a darker image.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.BlendMode.Screen
member.summary: Multiplies the complements of the source and destination colors, then complements the result, resulting in a lighter image.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.BlendMode.Overlay
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colors depending on the destination color, preserving highlights and shadows.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.BlendMode.Darken
member.summary: Selects the darker of the source and destination colors for each pixel.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.BlendMode.Lighten
member.summary: Selects the lighter of the source and destination colors for each pixel.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.BlendMode.ColorDodge
member.summary: Brightens the destination color to reflect the source color, resulting in a lighter image.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.BlendMode.ColorBurn
member.summary: Darkens the destination color to reflect the source color, resulting in a darker image.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.BlendMode.SoftLight
member.summary: Darkens or lightens the colors depending on the source color, creating a subtle effect.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.BlendMode.HardLight
member.summary: Similar to overlay but with source and destination reversed, creating a more dramatic effect.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.BlendMode.Difference
member.summary: Subtracts the darker of the two colors from the lighter color, creating an inverted effect.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.BlendMode.Exclusion
member.summary: Similar to difference but with lower contrast, resulting in a more muted effect.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.BlendMode.Hue
member.summary: Preserves the hue of the source color while using the saturation and luminosity of the destination.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.BlendMode.Saturation
member.summary: Preserves the saturation of the source color while using the hue and luminosity of the destination.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.BlendMode.Color
member.summary: Preserves the hue and saturation of the source color while using the luminosity of the destination.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.BlendMode.Luminosity
member.summary: Preserves the luminosity of the source color while using the hue and saturation of the destination.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.BlendMode.Clear
member.summary: Clears the destination area, making it fully transparent.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.BlendMode.Copy
member.summary: Copies the source over the destination, ignoring the destination.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.BlendMode.SourceIn
member.summary: Shows the source where both the source and destination overlap, otherwise displays transparency.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.BlendMode.SourceOut
member.summary: Shows the source where it doesn't overlap with the destination, otherwise displays transparency.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.BlendMode.SourceAtop
member.summary: Shows the source where it overlaps with non-transparent parts of the destination.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.BlendMode.DestinationOver
member.summary: Shows the destination over the source.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.BlendMode.DestinationIn
member.summary: Shows the destination where both the source and destination overlap, otherwise displays transparency.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.BlendMode.DestinationOut
member.summary: Shows the destination where it doesn't overlap with the source, otherwise displays transparency.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.BlendMode.DestinationAtop
member.summary: Shows the destination where it overlaps with non-transparent parts of the source.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.BlendMode.Xor
member.summary: Shows the source where it doesn't overlap with the destination and shows the destination where it doesn't overlap with the source.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.BlendMode.PlusDarker
member.summary: Adds the source and destination colors, favoring darker results.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.BlendMode.PlusLighter
member.summary: Adds the source and destination colors, favoring lighter results.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.CanvasExtensions.FillPath(Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.ICanvas,Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.PathF)
member.summary: Fills the specified path using the current fill color and the non-zero winding rule.
member.exception:
Thrown when the path is invalid for fill operations. This can occur when:
The path is empty or contains no drawable segments
The path contains invalid coordinates or operations
The path is not properly formed for the underlying graphics implementation
member.remarks: For best results with fill operations, ensure the path represents a closed shape by calling or manually connecting the end point back to the start point. Unclosed paths may produce unexpected results or exceptions depending on the graphics backend.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.CanvasExtensions.FillPath(Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.ICanvas,Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.PathF,Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.WindingMode)
member.summary: Fills the specified path using the current fill color and the specified winding rule.
member.param: The winding rule to use for determining which areas are inside the path.
member.exception:
Thrown when the path is invalid for fill operations. This can occur when:
The path is empty or contains no drawable segments
The path contains invalid coordinates or operations
The path is not properly formed for the underlying graphics implementation
member.remarks: For best results with fill operations, ensure the path represents a closed shape by calling or manually connecting the end point back to the start point. Unclosed paths may produce unexpected results or exceptions depending on the graphics backend.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.PathF
member.summary: Represents a geometric path consisting of lines, curves, and shapes using single-precision floating-point coordinates.

remarks.para: A path is composed of one or more sub-paths, each beginning with a Move operation and consisting of connected line segments, curves, and arcs. For fill operations to work reliably, paths should typically be closed using the method or by explicitly connecting the end point back to the starting point.
When creating paths for filling, ensure proper path construction to avoid exceptions during rendering. Paths that start with operations will automatically create an initial MoveTo operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.PathF.AddArc(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds an elliptical arc segment using coordinate values instead of points.
member.param: The X coordinate of the top-left corner of the bounding rectangle of the ellipse.
The Y coordinate of the top-left corner of the bounding rectangle of the ellipse.
The X coordinate of the bottom-right corner of the bounding rectangle of the ellipse.
The Y coordinate of the bottom-right corner of the bounding rectangle of the ellipse.
Starting angle of the arc in degrees. 0 points to the right (along the positive X axis). Angles increase counter-clockwise.
Ending angle of the arc in degrees, measured with the same convention as .
If true, the arc is drawn in the clockwise direction from to ; otherwise it is drawn counter-clockwise (the positive angle direction).
member.returns: The current path for chaining.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.PathF.AddArc(Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.PointF,Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.PointF,System.Single,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds an elliptical arc segment to the current sub-path.
member.param: The top-left point of the rectangle that bounds the full ellipse from which the arc segment is taken.
The bottom-right point of the bounding rectangle of the ellipse.
Starting angle of the arc in degrees. 0 points to the right (along the positive X axis). Angles increase counter-clockwise.
Ending angle of the arc in degrees, measured with the same convention as .
If true, the arc is drawn in the clockwise direction from to ; otherwise it is drawn counter-clockwise (the positive angle direction).
member.remarks:
Angle values are specified in degrees (not radians). The angular coordinate system used by for arcs is:
0 is the point on the ellipse at the positive X axis (to the right of center).
Positive angles advance counter-clockwise.
The direction of increasing Y on the drawing surface (often downwards in device pixels) does not change the counter-clockwise convention used for angles.
The current point is not implicitly connected to the start of the arc. If you need a straight line connection, call first.
member.returns: The current so that calls can be chained fluently.

member.summary: Specifies the algorithm used to determine which regions are inside or outside a path for filling.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.WindingMode.NonZero
member.summary: Uses the non-zero winding rule, which fills any region with a non-zero winding number. A point is inside the shape if a ray from that point to infinity crosses path segments with a non-zero net number of clockwise versus counter-clockwise crossings.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.WindingMode.EvenOdd
member.summary: Uses the even-odd rule, which fills regions based on alternating crossings. A point is inside the shape if a ray from that point to infinity crosses an odd number of path segments.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.XmlnsDefinitionAttribute
member.summary: Defines a mapping between an XML namespace and a CLR namespace.
member.remarks: This attribute is used to map XML namespaces to CLR namespaces for XAML processing.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.XmlnsDefinitionAttribute.XmlNamespace
member.summary: Gets the XML namespace.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maui.Graphics.XmlnsDefinitionAttribute.ClrNamespace
member.summary: Gets the CLR namespace.
